com.pump.swing

Class FilePanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • com.pump.swing.FilePanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class FilePanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    A panel that helps select a file.

    If launched in a JNLP, then this uses the local FileOpenService to select a File. Otherwise this uses the standard FileDialog (which requires this component be a descendant of Frame).

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • EXTENSIONS_KEY

        public static final java.lang.String EXTENSIONS_KEY
        The client property that maps to an array of Strings of acceptable file extensions.

      • FILE_DATA_KEY

        public static final java.lang.String FILE_DATA_KEY
        The client property that maps to the current FileData object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FilePanel

        public FilePanel(java.lang.String... extensions)
        Creates a FilePanel where the ID reads "File:"

      • FilePanel

        public FilePanel(java.lang.String fileID,
                 java.lang.String[] extensions,
                 javax.swing.JComponent... otherComponents)
        Creates a FilePanel.
        Parameters:
        fileID - the text in the identifying label on the left. Usually this will read "File:", or something similar.
        extensions - the file extensions this panel supports.
        otherComponents - additional components to put next to the "Browse..." button (such as a throbber, or other buttons)

    • Method Detail

      • getFileData

        public FilePanel.FileData getFileData()
        Returns:
        the current FileData object.

      • setExtensions

        public void setExtensions(java.lang.String... ext)
        Set the file extensions accepted in file dialogs.
        Parameters:
        ext - may be null, in which case no file filter is applied.

      • getExtensions

        public java.lang.String[] getExtensions()
        Return the file extensions accepted in file dialogs. This array may be null if not file filter is applied.

      • doBrowse

        public void doBrowse()
        Show a browse dialog, using the current file extensions if they are defined.

        In a JNLP session this uses a FileOpenService, but otherwise this uses an AWT file dialog.

      • doBrowse

        public static FilePanel.FileData doBrowse(java.awt.Component component,
                                          java.lang.String[] extensions)
        Show a browse dialog, using the current file extensions if they are defined.

        In a JNLP session this uses a FileOpenService, but otherwise this uses an AWT file dialog.

        Parameters:
        component - a component that relates to the Frame the possible dialog may be anchored to. This can be any component that is showing.
        extensions - a list of possible extensions (or null if all files are accepted).
        Returns:
        the FileData the user selected, or null if the user cancelled this operation.

      • setFile

        public void setFile(java.io.File file)
        Assign a File to this FilePanel.

      • getRightPanel

        public javax.swing.JPanel getRightPanel()
        Return the right panel, containing the file label, text field, and browse button.

      • getIDLabel

        public javax.swing.JLabel getIDLabel()
        Return the identifying label on the left that labels this file. This should contain text like "File:" or "Source:", but is not going to mention the file name.

      • getFileLabel

        public javax.swing.JLabel getFileLabel()
        Return the label representing the currently selected file. This will be visible if isEditable() returns false.

      • getBrowseButton

        public javax.swing.JButton getBrowseButton()
        Returns the "Browse..." button. This will be enabled if it is attached to a Frame.
